raw_outputs.complexity_llm:
time_complexity: O(n),
space_complexity: O(1),
explanation: The time complexity is O(n) because the function iterates n times, each loop multiplying an integer from 1 to n. There are no nested loops or recursive calls that would increase this complexity exponentially; therefore, it scales linearly with input size 'n'. Space complexity is O(1), meaning constant space usage irrespective of input data as the function uses a fixed amount of extra storage regardless of whether n equals 0 (returning an integer value) or any positive number. The code effectively calculates factorial iteratively and does not use additional memory that would grow with 'n'.
efficiency_score: 9
